Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by suggesting that Trump called the coronavirus outbreak a "hoax" when he was actually referring to the Democrats' politicization of the issue.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Trump did use the word "hoax," but it was in reference to the Democrats' attacks on his administration's handling of the outbreak, not the virus itself.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide sufficient evidence to back up the assertion that Trump called the coronavirus a "hoax."
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by not considering the context in which Trump used the word "hoax," which was in criticizing the Democrats' politicization of the issue.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that Trump's use of the word "hoax" was not directed at the virus itself, but rather at the Democrats' actions.
